name: Container
description: A foundational layout component that provides structured content containment with flexible theming, spacing, and responsive visibility controls.

is_contained.description: Whether the content is contained in a container.

with_background.description: Whether to display with a background.

vertical_spacing.description: Vertical spacing for the container (top, bottom, or both).

vertical_spacing_inner.description: Inner vertical spacing for the container (top, bottom, or both).

visibility.description: Responsive visibility settings for the container.

theme_support.light: Light theme variant with appropriate color schemes
theme_support.dark: Dark theme variant with appropriate color schemes

breakpoints.mobile: Base styles with responsive visibility controls
breakpoints.desktop: Large screen visibility and layout optimizations

slots.content: This content is contained within the container layout.

when_to_use: Provide consistent content width and alignment across different screen sizes
Create visual separation and structure for page layouts
Apply theme-appropriate background styling to content sections
Control responsive visibility of content sections
Standardize vertical spacing between content sections
when_not_to_use: Complex grid layouts where specific column arrangements are needed
Content that requires custom breakpoint behavior beyond the standard visibility options
Sections that need unique spacing or alignment that conflicts with the container's standardized approach
When the content needs to break out of container constraints for full-width display
best_practices: Use consistent container settings across similar content sections to maintain visual coherence
Choose appropriate vertical spacing to create clear content hierarchy without excessive whitespace
Consider the impact of responsive visibility settings on content accessibility and user experience
Use background styling sparingly to avoid overwhelming the visual hierarchy of the page
Test container behavior across different screen sizes to ensure content remains accessible and well-formatted
Combine with grid components when more complex layouts are needed within the container
Use contained vs fluid layouts appropriately based on the content type and design requirements

criteria_met.notes: Container adapts appropriately to different viewport sizes and zoom levels
Text remains readable when resized up to 200%
Background styling maintains sufficient contrast with content

known_issues: Responsive visibility: Complex visibility requirements may not be fully covered by the predefined options
Nested containers: Multiple levels of container nesting may create unexpected spacing or layout issues
Background styling: May not provide sufficient contrast in all theme combinations
variations: Contained Layout: Content is constrained to standard container width
Fluid Layout: Content spans full width of parent container
With Background: Container includes theme-appropriate background styling
Responsive Visibility: Container appears/disappears based on screen size
Custom Spacing: Various vertical spacing combinations for flexible layout control

findings: Consistent container usage improves user perception of site professionalism and structure
Responsive visibility controls help optimize content hierarchy across different devices
Background styling, when used appropriately, helps users distinguish content sections
